column4: Does anyone know how to connect to a windows shared drive from ubuntu ?
the filemamager is supposed to be able to browse the network and access shares
In my case, nautilus shows a folder called 'windows network', attempts to connect to it fail.
you can try entering the path to the share. ctrl-l then smb://server.ip.number/sharename
I've tried that as well. I always get errors.
I'll check now to see what the error is
let me guess... windows 7?
I don't think so. I think it's a 'windows server' somethingorother
see if you can ping it. see if smbtree and findsmb show it also.
ok. thanks.
findsmb doesn't see anything. smbtree just asks for my root password, and then doesn't do anything.
Howeve, the other windows machines in the house can see the share without problems
you can run smbrtee as a user.
can you even ping the server?
ok... when I use it as a user, I get the same thing. It asks for my password, and then just returns
Yeah, I've got no idea whats going on. I've been using linux for years, and I've never been able to connect to a windows share.
In this case, I was able to connect for a while, after months of trying. But then I rebooted my computer, and I can't reconnect.
ok. I'll do the basic network diagnostics...
random! It's working again.
just started working on its one
radom windows samba. ;0
you may want to look into a upnp video server for video streaming
